intro: Popowia iboundjiensis, commonly known as the Iboundji popowia, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically have five petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Popowia iboundjiensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils.
